revised_title: Determination of Rydberg Constants and Fine Structures of Hydrogen and Deuterium Using Reflexion Echelon
tldr: The authors used a reflexion echelon to measure the Rydberg constants and fine structures of hydrogen and deuterium. Their method eliminated the need for a Fabry-Perot interferometer and provided more accurate results. The study helped to determine the validity of spectroscopic methods for measuring the Rydberg constant and improve our understanding of atomic physics.
